author: Karen Butler
title: 'Doctor Who' to star Peter Capaldi for at least a third season
text:
| License Photo LONDON, Oct. 25 (UPI) -- Scottish actor Peter Capaldi is to continue playing the titular time-traveler in Doctor Who for a third season.
"Peter has made it clear he is happy playing the Doctor for as long as the BBC -- and viewers -- want him," a network source told The Mirror . "We are very happy with him and viewers are also warming to him."
The newspaper said the actor has signed on for another year, with an additional one-year option.
Capaldi, 57, is now in his second season as the star of the sci-fi show. He became the 12th actor to play the role after Matt Smith departed in 2013.
